title: Hungry Jack's are set to bring back their famous ham and cheese 'Yumbo' burger
text:
Fast food chain Hungry Jack's is planning to re-launch their famous ham and cheese 'Yumbo' burger after there was a 'mountain of pressure' from customers.

The Australian favourite - which contains five hot slices of ham and two pieces of cheese cheese - has Facebook pages named in its honour with people regularly campaigning the restaurant for news about its return.

'That is probably one of the most requested items to return to our stores,' Hungry Jack's CEO Chris Green told 6pr.

Fast food chain Hungry Jack's is planning to re-launch their famous ham and cheese 'Yumbo' burger after there was a 'mountain of pressure' from customers

'And I can tell you that it will be coming back very, very soon.'

The nationwide stores recently launched a new cheeseburger that has two slices of ham on it, and according to Mr Green, people were comparing it to the Yumbo.

'We are looking at bringing the Yumbo back early next year at breakfast time,' he added.

'That is probably one of the most requested items to return to our stores,' Hungry Jack's CEO Chris Green told 6pr

It was a regular fixture on the menu in the 1980s before it disappeared from stores, causing outrage and frustration from regular customers.

According to 'Bring Back The Hungry Jack's Yumbo' page on Facebook certain franchises in South Australia brought it back in February this year.

But now protesters are looking from a nationwide rollout.

There is no definite date set in stone yet but more details will be released soon.
description: Fast food chain Hungry Jack's are planning to re-launch their famous ham and cheese 'Yumbo' burger after there was a 'mountain of pressure' from customers.
authors: Matilda Rudd For Daily Mail Australia
